Posted By: Gruul_Treefolk (11/22/2008 2:27:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The +1 effect is incredible when on the offensive and I can't imagine many recovering from the 5 dragons, short of a board-sweeping spell.  
  
If I had them, I'd put four in pretty much any RG deck.  
  
Unfortunately, Magic will always have great cards at rare - making constructed at least partially a matter of having more funds. This is certainly one.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: I recently got him in a shards pack, and went crazy and I quickly put him in my Jund Shard deck. Just like Garruk all three of his abilities are handy, +1/+1 and haste for all creatures until end of turn, "borrowing" a creature for a turn and *five* 4/4 dragon tokens with flying make this guy fantasic in any R/G or Jund Shard deck.

Posted By: AshlingThePilgrim (1/11/2009 1:11:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
When I first saw this card spoiled, my train of thought went thusly:  
  
Fires of Yavimaya for a turn, nice.  
  
Threaten (or whatever the card is that has Sark's second effect) at least twice, not bad.  
  
Five 4/4 dragons into play........  
HOLY BEAN CURD! I believe my Timmy just had a heart attack out of sheer joy.  
  
If I ever get my hands him during a booster draft, he stays mine! Then, when I get home, I throw him in every RG deck I have.

posts.post_content: Awesome card, but as usual (and as should be) unless he's got some protection in your deck, he's just as easy to take out as that 4/4 creature you've got sitting there on the field. I'm not sure why somebody complained that he's not worth the money that Elspeth is worth, heck, you can pick up this guy for about 2 bucks on ebay for 4 of them. That's pretty darn cheap if you ask me.

Posted By: Westin (5/27/2009 5:58:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: sarkan is good for an offensive deck. his +1 ability doesnt keep counters on permanents though, so it has to be used continually for lasting effects. His second ability is pretty good, taking a creature to attack with it, but your opponent will still be able to use it on their turn, so if they have good defense, there isnt a point in taking a creature. His last ability is what i call "hey opponent, im gonna make this game one sided right now." Getting the dragons out will almost definately end the game, and fast. the only problem, is that his last ability takes a while to get to, which means time for your opponent to do something about sarkan, but all in all, great card.
posts.html:

Posted By: Elven_planeswalker (5/27/2009 4:51:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @mrywkoob: First off, he has the same cmc as [Garruk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk). Secondly, he and Garruk have amazing synergy. Untap two lands to put out a fatty, then give it +1/+1 and haste? Even putting [Chandra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra ) in with them won't hurt, considering she can wipe your opponents board clean in 3 turns usually. Deal 10 damage to your opponent and all of his/her creatures, give all of yours +4/+4 trample and haste? Chances are you just won the game.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: as far as planeswalkers go, this guy has no flavor, he has no taste, he's weak. his effect of bringing in red dragons is pretty cool, but take that in stride with the fact that THAT is his finisher and it's just disappointing. i mean, most planeswalkers cripple the opponent when they do their final effect, virtually giving you the game, but this guy just brings out a minor inconvenience. i mean, when i played him i just used the cumber stone to make all the fuss about him pointless, especially with the ever amazing broodstar on the field. they went wrong when they made this guy
